sub_topic: Probability of a certain medical condition occurring
message_1: In a population of 10,000, the probability of a certain medical condition occurring is 0.05. How many individuals in this population can be expected to have this medical condition?
message_2:
To find the expected number of individuals with the medical condition, we can multiply the population size by the probability of the condition occurring.

Expected number of individuals = Population size × Probability of the condition
Expected number of individuals = 10,000 × 0.05
Expected number of individuals = 500

So, in this population of 10,000, we can expect 500 individuals to have the medical condition.
